learning_outcomes.description: Apply the theory of promotional culture to create content in multiple modes.
Use promotional strategies to create visibility.
Apply social media tools to enhance engagement with target audiences.
Evaluate a social media campaign using industry specific tools.
Recommend future strategies to increase reach and engagement.
Critically reflect upon key themes which influence social media strategy.
Collaborate with colleagues to present social media communication and solutions.

assessments.assessment_title: CREATE: Plan and create an online exhibition video
assessments.task_description:
Purpose: Within industry contexts, creating content and communication for social media environments is an integral and common responsibility. This assignment serves as the foundations of the ‘promote’’ assignment which follows. For this assignment in a group you will create social media content, based on one theoretical theme from weeks 1-5. By carefully considering your target audience, you will create content for specific users and gain insight into ways of critically understanding social media communication strategy. 

Part A – Planning Strategy (1000 words maximum) 

Use the provided template to develop a written strategy document that outlines: 

Campaign Name 

Target audience 

  • Who is the target audience for this video? 

Strategy 

  • What is your overarching plan? 

Goal 

  • What are you trying to get your target audience to do or think? 

Objectives   

  • What are you hoping to achieve through this video? For example, comments, likes, shares, click-throughs, views etc.  

Key Message 

  • What is the message you want your viewers to take away? What do you want them to think about or discuss with friends? What change in behaviour or thinking are you trying to influence?  

Tactics 

  • What is your communication and creative tactic to reach and engage this target audience? 

Evaluation 

  • How will you measure the effectiveness of this video? For example: how many comments or likes or shares etc.  


Part B – Online Exhibition Video Series   

Create three videos (each max 2 minutes) that work as a cohesive series on your chosen theme that addresses promotional culture. These videos should be optimized for a social media audience and reflect a clear strategic intent which links all three as part of a sequence.

Submission instructions:

You must submit your videos in 2 locations:

  • Upload 3 x two-minute videos to the COMU3150 Social Media Communication Facebook Group
  • Upload the same 3 x two-minute videos to the COMU3150 Blackboard site using Echovideo. Follow the instructions found here on how to submit to Echovideo:
  • https://elearning.uq.edu.au/student-guides-ultra/video-assessment-ultra/submit-video-assignment-echovideo-ultra-student


Part C – Peer Evaluation   

To assess your contribution to group collaboration, you are required to complete a short peer evaluation using the Buddycheck tool on Blackboard. This evaluation will help determine your individual participation and group engagement throughout the planning and production of your video series. 

AI Use:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: PROMOTE: Promote your online exhibition video
assessments.task_description:
Purpose: An integral aspect of any social media communication campaign is finding innovative and effective promoting techniques. Now you have created your online exhibition video/s, you will use social media tools to enhance engagement through the use of hashtags, caption creation and engaging with influencers to share their content.

Part A – Peer Engagement:

  • Comment on at least 6 online exhibition video posts by other students.
  • Posts must have a professional tone and draw on the course theory.
  • Each post must not exceed 150 words.


Part B – Audience Profile Report (1000 words):

Complete the Audience Profile Report template to help you identify your target audience. Use your planning strategy document from Assignment 1 to inform the report. Adapt the template where necessary to best communicate who your target audience is.

Design an infographic to summarise your target audience persona, including:

  • An image (this can now be created using generative AI tools such as DALL·E or similar)
  • Their occupation
  • Their values
  • Social class
  • Hobbies and interests
  • Family


When using AI to create the image of your persona, please include

  • The prompt(s) you used to generate the image.
  • A brief reflection (2–3 sentences) on how the image aligns with your audience persona and why you chose it.


If sourcing your image from other places (e.g. stock images) ensure you cite these sources appropriately. 

Part C – Influencer Engagement (250 words):

Choose an appropriate real-life influencer to help promote your campaign.

Write them a message asking to collaborate with them including:

  • a justification of why they would be a great fit for your campaign;
  • the caption and hashtags you would like them to include;
  • a mock post to give the influencer an example of how they might promote your content, including caption and hashtags.


To help you select an influencer, consider the following:

  • Does the influencer’s audience base match your audience persona?
  • How popular are they, and can you afford to work with them?
  • Can you see a way to link their identity with your video?


When creating the mock post consider the following:

  • the norms of the platform the influencer uses;
  • make sure your mock post matches their usual communication style and tone;
  • how to best connect with their usual target audience.


Cover sheet - Use of Generative AI

In line with industry practice, you will make use of generative AI for this task (ie Microsoft Copilot, Claude.ai or Midjourney). You will need to:

1. Apply critical judgment to use and adapt GenAI output.

2. Complete the cover sheet available in Blackboard to indicate how you have used GenAI in the task. See the marking criteria sheet for further details on how this will be assessed. Please include a 100-150-word discussion about changes and adaptions you have made taking into account considerations such as ethics, bias that you may encounter during the process.


AI Use:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Post comments on at least 6 online exhibition video posts by other students to the group Facebook site (Part A). Take screen images of these comments and submit these images along with Part B and Part C of the assessment via the TurnItIn submission link provided on the course Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Purpose:

Within industry environments any form of social media campaign or communication will be critically evaluated upon completion.


The course team will deliver the data based on a past communication campaign. You will produce an evaluation and reflection report from that data.

 

Evaluation (1500 words):

Your evaluation should include:

●      a comparison of the posting styles and channel placements.

●      the strengths and weaknesses of the campaign overall based on the data and business objectives;

●      the benefits and limitations of the approach on the data and business objectives;

●      whether the original objectives were met (engagement/click throughs/likes/shares/comments etc);

●      how effective the message was at reaching the target audience;

●      any changes you would recommend for future campaigns, including recommendations for additional resources to strengthen the campaign. Evidence your recommended changes by linking to prior analysis.

●      You should consult at least 15 sources for this assignment task.

 

Reflection (1000 words):

Apply the SEAL framework to structure the reflection - SEAL: Situation, Effect, Action and Learning. Your reflection should consider:

●      the process you went through to create and promote the campaign;

●      the moral and ethical implications of such a campaign, linking to theories of promotional culture;

●      how this process has influenced the way you think of yourself as a digital media professional;

●      how this process has changed your thinking on what you view on social media and why.


AI Use

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit Part A and Part B via the TurnItIn submission link provided on the course Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 CREATE: Week 1 Seminar - Promotional Culture

This seminar will focus on how brands, governments, not-for-profit organisations and government policies shape advertising and media promotion.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 CREATE: Week 1 Seminar - Promotional Culture This seminar will focus on how brands, governments, not-for-profit organisations and government policies shape advertising and media promotion.

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 CREATE: Week 2 Lecture - Promotional Culture Ecology

In this seminar the historical evolution of promotional culture is considered and its integration into everyday life. The aim is to consider how brands entangle themselves in social media practice.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L06

Students analyse the content of online videos and consider the audience and objectives. Students create advertisements considering audience and medium. Students begin to develop a storyboard for the group video and develop a script.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L06

learning_activities.topic:
Module 1 CREATE: Week 4 Lecture - Producing Content

This seminar looks at the concept of the audience and how this has evolved over time and through different mediums. We will also look at the labour users perform when they engage with social media platforms, and how this differs from more traditional forms of media such as television. The relationship between labour and self-branding is explored.* STUDENTS TO ENROL IN CREATOR TRAINING TO SUPPORT ASSIGNMENT 2.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Module 1 CREATE: Week 4 Lecture - Producing Content This seminar looks at the concept of the audience and how this has evolved over time and through different mediums. We will also look at the labour users perform when they engage with social media platforms, and how this differs from more traditional forms of media such as television. The relationship between labour and self-branding is explored .* STUDENTS TO ENROL IN CREATOR TRAINING TO SUPPORT ASSIGNMENT 2.

Module 2 PROMOTE: Week 6 Lecture - Promotional Machines

The potential future projections for social media platforms are considered. We specifically focus on the ways our media platforms foster a promotional culture and how this may shift or escalate in the future through technologies like machine vision.
